page.title: 05TOURISM IN DALMALLY
page.content: From a tourist point of view there are many reasons for visiting the Dalmally area. The first of these would be to visit and investigate the various historical points of interest. These include churches,monuments, bridges, old villages. The second would be hillwalking. Around Dalmally there are several peaks of varying heights which can be tackled according to the experience of the walker. The most notable of these is Ben Cruachan 1101metres high which is quite a challenge for any walker or climber. Thirdly the area is popular for fishermen. Within the immediate vicinity there are rivers and lochs rich in both salmon and trout. Permits of course must be obtained before using most waters.
